posts.cooked:
@jaypatelani yes it certainly is, I think a lot of people have made WhatsApp their default due to familiarity and almost all their friends and family being there. It‚Äôs hard to break people away from unhealthy established habits

I want to start posting on my Facebook where I explain how WhatsApp isn‚Äôt open-source and therefore by design they could easily be scanning messages. WhatsApp lets anyone report messages/conversations to moderators so it has the ability to expose a supposedly private chat Signal is an open design so it can be verified as doing what it says. WhatsApp just claims to be end-to-end encrypted with the Signal protocol. Use the original creator of the protocol. It‚Äôs like if someone sold you a Toyota with a Ferrari engine. Obviously the original Ferrari car is better

Edit: @Avitus I found the tweet where Moxie shared Moses‚Äôs Hit Me on Signal song: https://nitter.net/moxie/status/1349075938911244288#m

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked: Absolutely! We Indians don‚Äôt need a messenger to text our friends and family. We need a messenger to text our friends, family members, and strangers!!! (The shopkeeper at the book store or to buy groceries, to inquire about a business, etc). And all this is not possible when there is mandatory profile sharing. Signal should take a leaf out of WhatsApp‚Äôs book and allow the user to hide profile picture.
